name: Prescribing of non-combination colecalciferol preparations
title: Prescribing of non-combination colecalciferol preparations per 1000 patients
description: Prescribing of non-combination colecalciferol preparations per 1000 patients
why_it_matters: Colecalciferol (vitamin D3) is commonly prescribed both as a combination product with calcium for osteoporosis and as an individal preparation.
NHS England guidance on prescribing products which are available over the counter states:
NHS advice is that people at risk of vitamin D deficiency should consider taking daily supplements of vitamin D,
which should be purchased from a pharmacy, supermarket or other retailer. No evidence supports taking vitamin D supplements to prevent or treat Covid-19.
People with medically confirmed deficiency may be prescribed vitamin D in line with NICE guidance.
This measure only shows colecalciferol prescriptions which are not prescribed as a combination product with other medicines.

There is significant variation in the price per unit for colecalciferol products. Our Price Per Unit Tool can help identify the most cost-effective options for your practice, although consideration needs to be given to the unlicensed status of some of the products.
